comments.body: We may not need to print the location of the VSCode install - I think it's pretty uniform (IntelliJ / Android Studio does tend to get installed in several places, so probably still useful for that tool). I guess the criteria for whether we display the vscode location is whether we think it'd be useful for users debugging issues, or use debugging users reported issues.
I'm OK with printing it here; helps to be consistent with the other doctors as well as to give the user some confidence.

I think there's less value for VS Code because we only look in default install locations; we don't really scan around (or support overriding the path). However I do think it may come in handy for debugging (esp on Windows where there are more options - there's 64bit + 32bit and also the paths aren't fixed since they come from progfiles env vars) and since doctor output is quite terse by default now, I don't think it's adding noise.

(ofc, I don't feel strongly either way, so happy to remove if requested)
keeping the directory sgtm; it makes sense for consistency w/ the other validators
